text:
Apache isn't loading the PHP modules correctly (at all).  my schedule.php file 
is served up as a downloadable file (browser offers to open or save it).
Inserted the following lines into httpd.conf as per PHP's install.txt:
LoadModule php4_module c:/php4.3.3/sapi/php4apache.dll
AddType application/x-httpd-php .php
AddModule mod_php4.c

creator: bobecklastimosa@yahoo.com
text:
I am also getting the same error message "[warn] (2)No such file or directory: 
exec() may not be safe" during start up and shutdown (via .bat file) even if 
the php module is loaded or not.  However, I don't see any malfunction in the 
Apache server despite the error. My system is: Windows 98SE, Apache 1.3.31 
(console start), PhP 4.3.6 (no-src, ran as a module), mySQL 4.0.20

I have the same bug - and I'm using version 1.3.33. Getting console error 
message:
"[warn] (2)No such file or directory: exec() may not be safe".
Symptoms: Apache serves .htm files ok, but does not parse .php docs - these are 
rendered as plain text.
Looks like file mod_php4.c is the culprit - it is missing from the 
distribution! I've tried both the src and non-src versions - same problem.
creator: r.prangnell@ntlworld.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
I think the exec() warning is harmless, but Win9x is not supported anyway.  Try
users@httpd.apache.org or a PHP list for help getting the PHP module loaded.
